message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.SI. 

The paper proposes an end-to-end approach for large-scale optimal transport in machine learning, which involves modeling the transport map via stochastic neural networks and enforcing the constraint on the marginal distributions via adversarial training. The proposed method is demonstrated to be effective in various real-world applications, including domain adaptation, image-to-image translation, and color transfer. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition), and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, since the method involves the use of neural networks, cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is also a likely sub-category. Finally, since the paper deals with optimization and constraint enforcement, cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is a possible sub-category as well.
